channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DELAD: Deep Landweber-guided deconvolution with Hessian and sparse prior
item.description: We present a model for non-blind image deconvolution that incorporates the classic iterative method into a deep learning application.

item.title: Dual Progressive Transformations for Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Weakly supervised semantic segmentation (WSSS), which aims to mine the object regions by merely using class-level labels, is a challenging task in computer vision.

item.title: ERNIE-ViL 2.0: Multi-view Contrastive Learning for Image-Text Pre-training
item.description: They attempt to learn cross-modal representation using contrastive learning on image-text pairs, however, the built inter-modal correlations only rely on a single view for each modality.

item.title: Individual Privacy Accounting with Gaussian Differential Privacy
item.description: In order to account for the individual privacy losses in a principled manner, we need a privacy accountant for adaptive compositions of randomised mechanisms, where the loss incurred at a given data access is allowed to be smaller than the worst-case loss.

item.title: SmallCap: Lightweight Image Captioning Prompted with Retrieval Augmentation
item.description: Recent advances in image captioning have focused on scaling the data and model size, substantially increasing the cost of pre-training and finetuning.

item.title: Medical Question Understanding and Answering with Knowledge Grounding and Semantic Self-Supervision
item.description: The system first matches the summarized user question with an FAQ from a trusted medical knowledge base, and then retrieves a fixed number of relevant sentences from the corresponding answer document.

item.title: Inharmonious Region Localization by Magnifying Domain Discrepancy
item.description: Inharmonious region localization aims to localize the region in a synthetic image which is incompatible with surrounding background.

item.title: ExtrudeNet: Unsupervised Inverse Sketch-and-Extrude for Shape Parsing
item.description: This paper studies the problem of learning the shape given in the form of point clouds by inverse sketch-and-extrude.

item.title: MobileViTv3: Mobile-Friendly Vision Transformer with Simple and Effective Fusion of Local, Global and Input Features
item.description: We propose changes to the fusion block that are simple and effective to create MobileViTv3-block, which addresses the scaling and simplifies the learning task.

item.title: Construction and Applications of Open Business Knowledge Graph
item.description: Business Knowledge Graph is important to many enterprises today, providing the factual knowledge and structured data that steer many products and make them more intelligent.

item.title: Your Out-of-Distribution Detection Method is Not Robust!
item.description: Therefore, unlike OOD detection in the standard setting, access to OOD, as well as in-distribution, samples sounds necessary in the adversarial training setup.

item.title: TinyTurbo: Efficient Turbo Decoders on Edge
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a neural-augmented decoder for Turbo codes called TINYTURBO .

item.title: Rethinking Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning: Introducing a New Notion and Standard Benchmarks
item.description: Though successful, federated learning presents new challenges for machine learning, especially when the issue of data heterogeneity, also known as Non-IID data, arises.

item.title: Learning with MISELBO: The Mixture Cookbook
item.description: Hence, we study the effect of instead using MISELBO as an objective function for learning mixtures, and we propose the first ever mixture of variational approximations for a normalizing flow-based hierarchical variational autoencoder (VAE) with VampPrior and a PixelCNN decoder network.

item.title: Diffusion-based Image Translation using Disentangled Style and Content Representation
item.description: Diffusion-based image translation guided by semantic texts or a single target image has enabled flexible style transfer which is not limited to the specific domains.

item.title: TabDDPM: Modelling Tabular Data with Diffusion Models
item.description: Denoising diffusion probabilistic models are currently becoming the leading paradigm of generative modeling for many important data modalities.

item.title: Rethinking skip connection model as a learnable Markov chain
item.description: In this work, we deep dive into the model's behaviors with skip connections which can be formulated as a learnable Markov chain.

item.title: Variable-Based Calibration for Machine Learning Classifiers
item.description: In this paper we introduce the notion of variable-based calibration to characterize calibration properties of a model with respect to a variable of interest, generalizing traditional score-based calibration and metrics such as expected calibration error (ECE).

item.title: Verifiable and Energy Efficient Medical Image Analysis with Quantised Self-attentive Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Convolutional Neural Networks have played a significant role in various medical imaging tasks like classification and segmentation.

item.title: Parea: multi-view ensemble clustering for cancer subtype discovery
item.description: We apply and validate our methodology on real-world multi-view cancer patient data.

item.title: Metro: Memory-Enhanced Transformer for Retrosynthetic Planning via Reaction Tree
item.description: In this work, we first develop a benchmark curated for the retrosynthetic planning task, which consists of 124, 869 reaction trees retrieved from the public USPTO-full dataset.

item.title: MEIM: Multi-partition Embedding Interaction Beyond Block Term Format for Efficient and Expressive Link Prediction
item.description: Knowledge graph embedding aims to predict the missing relations between entities in knowledge graphs.

item.title: Safe Exploration Method for Reinforcement Learning under Existence of Disturbance
item.description: We define the safety during learning as satisfaction of the constraint conditions explicitly defined in terms of the state and propose a safe exploration method that uses partial prior knowledge of a controlled object and disturbance.

item.title: Batch Multivalid Conformal Prediction
item.description: Multivalid coverage guarantees are stronger than marginal coverage guarantees in two ways: (1) They hold even conditional on group membership -- that is, the target coverage level $1-\alpha$ holds conditionally on membership in each of an arbitrary (potentially intersecting) group in a finite collection $\mathcal{G}$ of regions in the feature space.

item.title: Teaching Where to Look: Attention Similarity Knowledge Distillation for Low Resolution Face Recognition
item.description: Deep learning has achieved outstanding performance for face recognition benchmarks, but performance reduces significantly for low resolution (LR) images.

item.title: A Coarse-to-fine Cascaded Evidence-Distillation Neural Network for Explainable Fake News Detection
item.description: Existing fake news detection methods aim to classify a piece of news as true or false and provide veracity explanations, achieving remarkable performances.

item.title: AICCA: AI-driven Cloud Classification Atlas
item.description: Clouds play an important role in the Earth's energy budget and their behavior is one of the largest uncertainties in future climate projections.

item.title: TERMinator: A system for scientific texts processing
item.description: This paper is devoted to the extraction of entities and semantic relations between them from scientific texts, where we consider scientific terms as entities.

item.title: polyBERT: A chemical language model to enable fully machine-driven ultrafast polymer informatics
item.description: polyBERT is a chemical linguist that treats the chemical structure of polymers as a chemical language.

item.title: Evaluating the temporal understanding of neural networks on event-based action recognition with DVS-Gesture-Chain
item.description: A wide range of benchmark datasets is available to allow for the evaluation of such capabilities when using conventional frame-based video sequences.

item.title: Human Motion Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Motion Diffusion Model (MDM), a carefully adapted classifier-free diffusion-based generative model for the human motion domain.

item.title: R2C-GAN: Restore-to-Classify GANs for Blind X-Ray Restoration and COVID-19 Classification
item.description: The proposed restoration approach achieves over 90% F1-Score which is significantly higher than the performance of any deep model.

item.title: Compressed Gastric Image Generation Based on Soft-Label Dataset Distillation for Medical Data Sharing
item.description: Furthermore, our method can extract essential weights of DCNN models to reduce the memory required to save trained models for efficient medical data sharing.

item.title: Dilated Neighborhood Attention Transformer
item.description: These models typically employ localized attention mechanisms, such as the sliding-window Neighborhood Attention (NA) or Swin Transformer's Shifted Window Self Attention.

item.title: Perturbations and Subpopulations for Testing Robustness in Token-Based Argument Unit Recognition
item.description: Argument Unit Recognition and Classification aims at identifying argument units from text and classifying them as pro or against.

item.title: Neural Media Bias Detection Using Distant Supervision With BABE -- Bias Annotations By Experts
item.description: Fine-tuning and evaluating the model on our proposed supervised data set, we achieve a macro F1-score of 0. 804, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Start Small: Training Game Level Generators from Nothing by Learning at Multiple Sizes
item.description: The results show that our methods can generate high-quality diverse levels for Sokoban, Zelda and Danger Dave for a variety of sizes, after only 3h 29min up to 6h 11min (depending on the game) of training on a single commodity machine.

item.title: Regularizing Neural Network Training via Identity-wise Discriminative Feature Suppression
item.description: It suppresses features that can be utilized to identify individual instances among samples within each class.

item.title: Spikformer: When Spiking Neural Network Meets Transformer
item.description: Spikformer (66. 3M parameters) with comparable size to SEW-ResNet-152 (60. 2M, 69. 26%) can achieve 74. 81% top1 accuracy on ImageNet using 4 time steps, which is the state-of-the-art in directly trained SNNs models.

item.title: 3D UX-Net: A Large Kernel Volumetric ConvNet Modernizing Hierarchical Transformer for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Hierarchical transformers (e. g., Swin Transformers) reintroduced several ConvNet priors and further enhanced the practical viability of adapting volumetric segmentation in 3D medical datasets.

item.title: Open-source tool for Airway Segmentation in Computed Tomography using 2.5D Modified EfficientDet: Contribution to the ATM22 Challenge
item.description: Airway segmentation in computed tomography images can be used to analyze pulmonary diseases, however, manual segmentation is labor intensive and relies on expert knowledge.

item.title: Proportional Multicalibration
item.description: Multicalibration is a desirable fairness criteria that constrains calibration error among flexibly-defined groups in the data while maintaining overall calibration.

item.title: Towards General-Purpose Representation Learning of Polygonal Geometries
item.description: For the spatial domain approach, we propose ResNet1D, a 1D CNN-based polygon encoder, which uses circular padding to achieve loop origin invariance on simple polygons.

item.title: Augmentation Backdoors
item.description: It is well known that backdoors can be inserted into machine learning models through serving a modified dataset to train on.

item.title: Patients' Severity States Classification based on Electronic Health Record (EHR) Data using Multiple Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
item.description: For implementing Deep Learning we employed a feed-forward neural network (multi-layer) and the Fast Large Margin approach for semi-supervised learning.

item.title: Online pseudo labeling for polyp segmentation with momentum networks
item.description: In this work, we present a new pseudo labeling strategy that enhances the quality of pseudo labels used for training student networks.

item.title: A Two-Stage Method for Chinese AMR Parsing
item.description: In this paper, we provide a detailed description of our system at CAMRP-2022 evaluation.

item.title: COLO: A Contrastive Learning based Re-ranking Framework for One-Stage Summarization
item.description: Traditional training paradigms for extractive and abstractive summarization systems always only use token-level or sentence-level training objectives.

item.title: Federated Stain Normalization for Computational Pathology
item.description: As a solution, we propose BottleGAN, a generative model that can computationally align the staining styles of many laboratories and can be trained in a privacy-preserving manner to foster federated learning in computational pathology.

item.title: Understanding Collapse in Non-Contrastive Learning
item.description: Contrastive methods have led a recent surge in the performance of self-supervised representation learning (SSL).
